prompt: <description>Part 1 Create the first part of the assembly Shape: A three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. 1. Set up the coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector of [0.7125, 0, 0]. 2. Create the sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. 3. Draw line 1: starting at [0.0, 0.0], ending at [0.0375, 0.0]. 4. Draw line 2: starting at [0.0375, 0.0], ending at [0.0375, 0.315]. 5. Draw line 3: starting at [0.0375, 0.315], ending at [0.0, 0.315]. 6. Draw line 4: starting at [0.0, 0.315], ending at [0.0, 0.0]. 7. Apply a scale operation to the sketch with the scaling factor of 0.315. 8. Extrude the sketch along the Z-axis by 0.3 units with NewBodyFeatureOperation. Part 2 Create the second part of the assembly Shape: A rectangular prism with two holes on the top surface. 1. Set up the coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector of [0,0,0]. 2. Create a sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. 3. Draw line 1: starting at [0.0, 0.0], ending at [0.0, 0.1575]. 4. Draw line 2: starting at [0.0, 0.1575], ending at [0.0, 0.315]. 5. Draw line 3: starting at [0.0, 0.315], ending at [0.7125, 0.315]. 6. Draw line 4: starting at [0.7125, 0.315], ending at [0.7125, 0.0]. 7. Draw line 5: starting at [0.7125, 0.0], ending at [0.0, 0.0]. 8. Draw circle 1: centered at [0.0645, 0.1575] with a radius of 0.0131. 9. Draw circle 2: centered at [0.1995, 0.1575] with a radius of 0.0131. 10. Apply a scale operation to the sketch with the scaling factor of 0.7125. 11. Extrude the sketch along the Z-axis by 0.0375 units with JoinFeatureOperation. Part 3 Create the third part of the assembly Shape: A cylindrical object with a tapered top and a flat bottom. 1. Set up the coordinate system with euler angles of [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector of [0.75, 0.1431, 0.1356]. 2. Create the sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. 3. Draw circle 1: centered at [0.0144, 0.0144] with a radius of 0.0144. 4. Apply a scale operation to the sketch with the scaling factor of 0.0289. 5. Extrude the sketch along the negative Z-axis by 0.0375 units with CutFeatureOperation.</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with no rotation or translation. 1. Create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. 2. Draw 8 connected lines on the sketch to form a closed shape. Below are the start and end points of each line. - Line 1: (0.0, 0.0), (0.75, 0.0) - Line 2: (0.75, 0.0), (0.75, 0.007) - Line 3: (0.75, 0.007), (0.6977, 0.007) - Line 4: (0.6977, 0.007), (0.6977, 0.3942) - Line 5: (0.6977, 0.3942), (0.75, 0.3942) - Line 6: (0.75, 0.3942), (0.75, 0.4012) - Line 7: (0.75, 0.4012), (0.0, 0.4012) - Line 8: (0.0, 0.4012), (0.0, 0.0) 3. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. 4. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D using the following parameters: - Euler angles: (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) - Translation vector: (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) 5. Extrude the sketch to generate the 3D model with the depth of 0.1047 towards the normal and 0.0 towards the opposite normal. **Part 2: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side.** 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following transformation: - Euler angles: (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) - Translation vector: (0.6977, 0.007, 0.0) 2. Create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. 3. Draw 4 connected lines on the sketch to form a closed shape. Below are the start and end points of each line. - Line 1: (0.0, 0.0), (0.0523, 0.0) - Line 2: (0.0523, 0.0), (0.0523, 0.3872) - Line 3: (0.0523, 0.3872), (0.0, 0.3872) - Line 4: (0.0, 0.3872), (0.0, 0.0) 4. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.3872. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D using the following parameters: - Euler angles: (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) - Translation vector: (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) 6. Extrude the sketch to generate the 3D model with the depth of 0.0767 towards the normal and 0.0 towards the opposite normal. **Final shape:** The final shape is derived from part 1, a rectangular prism with a curved side. Dimensions: - Length: 0.75 units - Width: 0.75 units - Height: 0.5092 units</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism with a Sloped Side The first part is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height, with the sloped side angled at 45 degrees. **Step 1**: Draw a 2D sketch for the base of the prism. In the sketch, create a rectangle with dimensions of 0.75 units in length and 0.015 units in width. For the sloped side, create a line from the top-right corner of the rectangle with a length of 0.75 units and a slope of 45 degrees, intersecting the bottom-left corner of the rectangle. **Step 2**: Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. This will make the length of the prism 2 units. **Step 3**: Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.015, 0.0] **Step 4**: Extrude the 3D sketch to a depth of 0.015 units towards the normal and 0 units in the opposite direction, while applying a sketch scale of 0.75. This will create the final cad model for part 1. Here's the JSON representation of the intermediate part: ```json { "coordinate_system": { "Euler Angles": [ 0.0, 0.0, -90.0 ], "Translation Vector": [ 0.0, 0.015, 0.0 ] }, "sketch": { "face_1": { "loop_1": { "line_1": { "Start Point": [ 0.0, 0.0 ], "End Point": [ 0.3, 0.0 ] }, "line_2": { "Start Point": [ 0.3, 0.0 ], "End Point": [ 0.3, 0.75 ] }, "line_3": { "Start Point": [ 0.3, 0.75 ], "End Point": [ 0.0, 0.75 ] }, "line_4": { "Start Point": [ 0.0, 0.75 ], "End Point": [ 0.0, 0.0 ] } } } }, "extrusion": { "extrude_depth_towards_normal": 0.015, "extrude_depth_opposite_normal": 0.0, "sketch_scale": 0.75, "operation": "NewBodyFeatureOperation" }, "description": { "shape": "A rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. The sloped side is angled at 45 degrees.", "length": 0.75, "width": 0.015, "height": 0.75 } } ``` This concludes the instructions for part 1. The following sections will provide instructions for the remaining parts.</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Cylindrical Object with a Rectangular Opening** Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1 with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0254, 0.2057, 0.0] Sketch the first face of the part as follows: - Draw a line from (0.3078, 0.1275) to (0.6409, 0.1275) - Draw an arc starting at (0.6409, 0.1275), with the midpoint at (0.0, 0.0), ending at (0.5434, 0.3631) - Draw a line from (0.5434, 0.3631) to (0.3078, 0.1275) Sketch the second face by mirroring the first face along the axis defined by the line connecting the start and end points of the arc in the first face. Sketch the third face as follows: - Draw an arc from (0.4975, 0.4014), through (0.5213, 0.3833), to (0.5434, 0.3631) - Draw a line from (0.5434, 0.3631) to (0.6025, 0.4222) - Draw a line from (0.6025, 0.4222) to (0.5604, 0.4644) - Draw a line from (0.5604, 0.4644) to (0.4975, 0.4014) Sketch the fourth face as follows: - Draw an arc from (0.6356, 0.187), through (0.6396, 0.1574), to (0.6409, 0.1275) - Draw a line from (0.6409, 0.1275) to (0.7246, 0.1275) - Draw a line from (0.7246, 0.1275) to (0.7246, 0.187) - Draw a line from (0.7246, 0.187) to (0.6356, 0.187) The sketch is now complete. Scale the 2D sketch by 0.7246. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] (same as the coordinate system) - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] (same as the coordinate system) Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following parameters: - Extrude depth towards normal: 0.1654 - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 - Sketch scale: 0.7246 - Operation: Create a new solid body The first part of the CAD assembly is now complete.</description>
